intro: Eremogone shannanensis, commonly known as the Shannan eremogone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes species known for their distinctive bracts and often edible leaves. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
